Your bike can do so much more than just take you from one place to another.\n In fact, instead of being an additional expense in your life, it can be a money generating machine.
Whether you want to pay off your bike, make money on the side, or find a full time gig, then keep reading.\n We\'re covering many ways your bike can make you money.
When you\'re not using your bike you can make passive income by renting it out to other people!\n Companies like Uber, Careem and Food Panda are the best apps to do this.
Just make a free listing, pick the days your bike is available, then people can start renting it.\n You can make 30k plus every month depending on your ride or delivery.
Food delivery apps are also extremely flexible.\n You can work when you want and for the most part - as much as you want so it doesn\'t matter what kind of schedule you have.

Every food delivery app pays differently based on location.\n We recommend researching who pays the best in your area.\n You can also sign up for more than one so you\'re never sitting around waiting for orders.
Decades ago it wwould not be possible to mke money with your bike.
Now,there are so many apps and awesome compnies you can make money with.
Hopefully you found an idea that works for you so you can start making more money!
User Name
Business Ranging From 10k-100k
Multani Mitti
Business of Led Bulb

Your car can do so much more than just take you from one place to another.\n In fact, instead of being an additional expense in your life, it can be a money generating machine.
Whether you want to pay off your car, make money on the side, or find a full time gig? then keep reading.\n We\'re covering many ways, your car can make you money.
When you\'re not using your car,you can make passive income by renting it out to other people!\n Companies like Uber, Careem etc are the best apps to do this.
Just make a free listing, pick the days your car is available, then people can start renting it.\n You can make 60k plus every month depending on your ride or delivery.
Food Delivery
The Bottom Line
Food delivery apps are also extremely flexible.\n You can work when you want and for the most part - as much as you want so it doesn\'t matter what kind of schedule you have.

Every food delivery app pays differently based on location.\n We recommend researching who pays the best in your area.\n You can also sign up for more than one so you\'ve never sitting around waiting for orders.

Shutterstock is a stock photo website where photographers and videographers can make money by uploading their work.
 If you sign up as a Shutterstock Contributor you will be paid every time your photos or videos are downloaded.
 Shutterstock has paid out more than $1 BILLION to its contributors.
 You can get a slice of that pie! Keep reading for more info.
What is it?
What is it For?

Shutterstock is an online photo database where users everywhere can upload their photography, videography, graphic designs and more.\n Your work can then earn money every time it\'s used by someone else.\n If you have a large library of popular photos that people are downloading, this can turn into a passive income stream.
Who is it For?

You might be thinking that you need to be a world-class photographer to earn money, but that’s simply not the case.\n Anyone with at least a DSLR camera and basic photography skills can earn income.\n Obviously though, the more photography expertise you have the more successful you will be.

Shutterstock payments are divided into different tiers.\n You’ll initially earn US$0.25 per download, but as you earn more your earnings can rise as high as US$2.85 per download.\n For videos and custom images you will earn 20% to 30% for your content.
How Does it Pay?
Cons

Need a decent camera. At least a DSLR 
 Can take time to build a quality portfolio that people are downloading consistently
 Photos need to get approved by Shutterstock
 Only get to keep 30% of what your content sells for

If you have a passion for photography and know how to compose a decent shot, becoming a Shutterstock contributor can lead to an impressive passive income stream.\n And if you love taking photos, it can be a rewarding way to earn money from one of your personal talents.
Also making money with photography:\n Make money selling your iPhone/android photos with Foap

AirBnB is an app where millions of people are making money renting out their extra bedroom, entire house or unused space to travellers./n There are over 500,000 bookings every night on Airbnb in over 190 countries./n Wherever you are in the world, chances are you can start making money as an Airbnb Host./n Here is how you can make Airbnb an income stream, even if you don\'t own a home.
How Does AirBnB Work?
All you need to start making money is a spare room, apartment or house, however small or big it may be./n If you have that simply sign up as an Airbnb Host and create your listing.
If you don’t have an extra room or don\'t own a home there are still options:

Use other people’s properties and start an Airbnb management company
 Rent out your place while you are travelling/not at home
 You can convert one of your rooms into an extra bedroom
 Ask your landlord for permission to use Airbnb (give them some profits)
 Buy a property to use for Airbnb
 Find a friend who has a room(s) and make a deal with them.
How much can you earn?

Some people can cover their mortgage payments with Airbnb others are running a full time business with multiple properties.
There is no limit to how much you can earn, it depends how serious you want to take it.
 In general, your location and the type of space you have is what will determine your income.
A luxury condo in Las Vegas will earn more than a 1 bedroom house in a small town.
 Click here to see how much your place is worth.
Here are some variables that will determine your income:

Your nightly price
 Your vacancy rate - how many nights will you be booked
 Your place - How many guests you can accommodate, size of home, amenities etc.
 Your location - is there tourism, heavy business area, a travel hotspot, a large city?
 Time of year/season/n Competition - Supply/demand in your area affects the price
 Automation - if you want it to be 100% passive there will be more expenses
How to Get Started
If you\'re interested in starting your own Airbnb business as a side hustle or to build passive income we actually made an entire app on this topic!/n You can download our free Airbnb guide here/n
If you want a quick overview here is the basic process for getting your first booking:

Get a room or house you can list on Airbnb
 Make an airbnb account - You can sign up here
 Create a great listing - Airbnb walks you through the process
 Start receiving bookings - Set your calendar, price and let the money start coming in
 Welcome your guest - Prepare the property and wait for your guests to arrive
 Get paid - Once your guests finish their stay you automatically get paid! Airbnb keeps 3%.
 Set up systems (optional) - Set things up like self-check in, cleaning services, and more so you have a passive income stream.
 Anyone can do Airbnb without prior experience. But there are a lot of steps involved.
 If you want to save time download our free Airbnb guide to get your listing up in a few hours!
Find Out How Much Your Unit Will Make

Millions of people are using Airbnb.\nIf you want a slice of the pie start by finding out how much you can earn in your area!\n If you\'re interested in starting your own Airbnb business as a side hustle or to build passive income download our free Airbnb guide here for step by step instructions

If you don’t already know, Airbnb essentially lets you become your own hotel.
 Millions of people are making money by listing an extra bedroom, entire home or unused space on Airbnb and renting it out to travellers.
 Many people think that being a successful Airbnb host requires owning your own properties but that doesn't have to be the case always.
 You can actually earn a hefty amount of money renting out other people's properties.
 In this article you'll learn how you can do Airbnb without owning a home -
 it's called a HSMC and it's a genius business model.
How Does A HSMC Work?
There are MILLIONS of homeowners who have an extra unused room or empty vacation home that\'s just collecting dust. That’s where YOU come in.

You will find these homeowners and pitch them on listing their extra room or home on Airbnb so you can both make money. /nYou tell them you will run the Airbnb and manage it and they collect 50% of profits for letting you use their property.
Why would they say yes?

Their property is empty anyways so they will say yes if you pitch it successfully.
 Without you, they are losing money or leaving money on the table.
 They also have zero idea on how to use Airbnb and don’t have the time to learn.
 Once they say yes, you’re going to create the listing on Airbnb (takes a few hours at most).
 Then you start getting guests and collect the passive income that comes in each month through that listing.
Then you're making money from real estate with zero ownership of any homes. Amazing, right?
Pros and Cons of a HSMC

This business model wasn\'t available decades ago and you used to need a big downpayment to buy a property.\n But thanks to the invention of Airbnb and similar apps anyone can get into real estate with some work ethic.\n Let\'s look at the pros and cons to see if it\'s right for you.

There are over 500,000 bookings on Airbnb every single night in over 191 countries! All you need to do is pitch a property owner to work with you.\n Once you do that you can list their place on Airbnb and start builing a stream of passive income.\n

You can take this idea and start right now on your own! However, if you want someone to walk you through every single step then take Tai Lopez\'s HSMC Course.\n By learning from a mentor you will save some time and build it right.

The exploding market for online courses is a lucrative opportunity for passive income.\nIf you’ve got a skillset that you think is marketable, and the ability to communicate it effectively to others, this avenue could be perfect for you.
What Is Skillshare and Udemy?
They are online platforms designed to empower people with certain skills to share those skills with those looking to learn them.

They are online platforms designed to empower people with certain skills to share those skills with those looking to learn them. .\nThey provide an opportunity for creators to produce and upload courses that can range from video-centric to more test-heavy options, depending on your personal production skills.

First and foremost, you’ll obviously need a marketable skill to teach.
 But you’d be surprised at the wide variety of courses that do well on Udemy.
 There are dozens of categories and subcategories, so you’re sure to find a niche that perfectly suits your own perfectly set of marketable skills.
 But you’ll need something more than skills—you’ll need to be a skilled communicator to help people benefit from what you have to say.
 If you can hold your own in front of a video camera and communicate what you know with clarity, you’ll do well.

This is a difficult number to pin down, as Udemy and Skillshare earnings can range from a couple hundred dollars per year to tens of thousands each month.
 It all comes down to how well your course performs. 
 There are things you can do to increase your chances.
 Uploading some of your videos to YouTube and linking them back to your course, or using other marketing channels to promote your course. 
Other Udemy newbies will often offer their courses for free at first to drive traffic and get ratings, before switching to a payed model once they have a bit of a reputation on the site.
 As for Skillshare, the site works on a royalty system that determines how much you earn based on how many total minutes of your classes are watched.
 The site says that first-time teachers tend to earn around $200 in their first month, while established teachers can earn as much as $3,000 per month.
 We recommend uploading your course to both Udemy and Skillshare to get the most possible traffic.
Potential for significant earnings\n Uses skills you already have \n No start-up costs

Can take some time to build reputation
 Big initial time investment of planning, filming, and editing courses
 Organic revenue is split 50/50 with Udemy
 On Skillshare, royalties are shared among the all teachers—higher view rates lead to higher earnings.

First you’ll want to begin taking notes on which of your skills might be the most marketable.\n Head to Udemy or Skillshare to see which types of courses are doing well, or which ones have gaps that you could fill.
Summary

Udemy and Skillshare offer excellent opportunities to turn your skills and teaching abilities into cash. 
If you’re willing to put in the initial setup work, it could turn into a lucractive source of passive income.
 Click here to get 2 free months of Skillshare premium.
 You can see what their service is like from the mind of a student.

Have you ever wondered who ATMs belong to? 
Who puts them there? 
And who’s earning that fee you’re charged every time you use one? 
 If you read on you'll find out how you can start an ATM machine business yourself, all of those transaction fees could be going directly into your pocket.
 Let’s find out how.
The Business Model

ATMs aren’t always owned by banks or large organizations./n Often they’re owned by savvy businesspeople looking to capitalize on a consistent need that people have on a daily basis—the need to pull cash out of their bank accounts without running into an actual bank.
 It’s pretty simple, really.
 You do the research to find ideal locations for ATMs that don’t already have them.
 These include gas stations and convenience stores, groceries and supermarkets, clubs, restaurants, bars, shopping malls, fairs and carnivals, etc.
 You then deal with the business owner directly to negotiate an agreement to provide them with an ATM.
You buy the machine, install it, connect it to the internet or phone line, and load cash into the machine.
 Every time someone uses your ATM, you’ll receive the surcharge—usually somewhere in the general vicinity of 3000.
That may seem like a lot, but imagine an 8-hour business day in a busy shopping mall.
 If only 20 people use your machine to withdraw cash, that’s 2000 a day which translates to a passive income of 10,800 a month.
While you’ll need to subtract costs like transaction fees to the company that processes the card and the minor costs of paper receipt rolls, that’s just a conservative figure for a single machine.
 We know what you’re wondering—where does the cash in the machine come from? You have a couple of options here. 
The first is to use your own money, which has the benefit of allowing you to keep more of your profits.
 (Don’t worry—the amount of cash removed will be matched to you in a payment from the ATM user.) 
The obvious risks of this involve the need to carry and stock a ten thousand rupeesor more at a time in your ATM, which might invite theft.
 Another option is to use a cash service, which you’ll pay a fee in exchange for them handling the restocking of your ATM and providing cash to fill it.
 This will eat into your profits more, but will also insulate you against the risk of being the victim of a robbery.

Because of low overhead fees that come from freedom from a need for employees or business space, you’re potential for profit is significant.
 Income will vary significantly based on location, how many machines you own, and how many transactions you process. 
But many ATM business owners enjoy a profit of 4,00,000/year from just one machine. 
With multiple machines, that number increases exponentially.

Very little work involved to maintain business after initial startup 
 Companies available to help guide your initial setup 
 Relatively simple business model 
 No prior business experience required
 Mobile monitoring of cash levels

Some startup capital required to purchase machines, which can cost anywhere from 30,000 to 1,00,000 \n Negotiation and social skills required to land desirable locations and agreement terms with businesses that host machines \n Stocking cash into machines can be dangerous depending on area; consider hiring an ATM restocking company or placing ATMs only in safe areas
As with many businesses, research is key. \nThere are many companies online that provide a complete guide to help you get set up, from data gathering to purchasing or leasing machines.

If you’ve always wanted to own a business as a passive income stream, buying or opening a laundromat can be a lucrative and low-startup-cost opportunity.\n Plus, the industry has recently undergone a much more appealing transformation than its dingy history suggests.

Buying a laundromat is a viable option for someone with a bit of up-front capital associated with buying or launching a business.
 Total costs of buying a laundromat range from 2,00,000 to 5,00,000, though you can always pick up a business loan.
 And while its possible to own and operate a laundromat as a side-hustle, you will need a bit of time to devote to its management and maintenance.
 That being said, hiring a trusted day-to-day manager can take much of that pressure off of you.
 Don’t think you know enough about laundromats to start one? 
Industry experts say that the majority of owners had no prior business ownership or laundromat experience prior to starting their own.

The average laundromat grosses anywhere between 3,00,000 to 1 million per year.
 That of course depends on a wide range of factors, including location, how well the business is run, and foot traffic.
 Expenses generally run about 65% off gross income.
 That means if your laundromat grosses 8,00,000 a year, you can walk away with a profit of 2,80,000.
 You can earn even more with higher profits and higher margins.
 Overall, it’s a surprisingly lucrative investment, whether you ultimately own one location or several.
 The key, according to industry experts, is you—the owner.
 Better-run laundromats earn more with higher margins. 
If you’re willing to put in the energy to make your laundromat clean, pleasant, and offer service others don’t, you’ll be rewarded with greater earnings.
Pros

Powerful passive income with a high ceiling 
 Prestige of being a legitimate business owner
 Opportunity for expansion if initial location performs well
 Priceless skills acquired by running business

Large up-front capital required 
 Costs associated with buying, starting, marketing and operating business 
 Standard risks associated with opening brick-and-mortar business location

As with any business, the key is: research, research, research.
 One of the most important factors to consider is location.
 Established neighborhoods often have at least a couple of laundromats already, and customers are more likely to stick with one they know than a new upstart.
 One option is to renovate an existing location, or you can find an area experiencing rapid population growth. 
 In any case, developing a legitimate business plan will be the first major step in getting on your way to becoming the laundromat king of your city.
Buying a laundromat may be a bigger step than some passive income seekers are ready for, but if you’re willing to make the leap you could be rewarded with significant earning
We know what you’re thinking. \n“There’s no way owning a few vending machines can even be called a ‘business.’

You’d be surprised at how lucrative a vending machine business can become with a surprisingly lowkey commitment on your end.\n In this short article, we might just convince you that it’s the perfect passive income opportunity to help jumpstart your earnings.

According to U.S. statistics from Brandongaille.com, vending machines earn over $7 billion in sales every year, resulting in $65 million in profits on an annual basis.\n This mostly cash-based business has evolved in recent years, as healthy snacks have begun selling nearly three times as well as junk food and sodas.
Who is this for?

You’ll need a bit of startup capital to purchase the machines.\n Another factor to consider is that there’s a bit of a time investment involved with restocking the machines.\n But once you have a certain level of earnings, you can consider outsourcing the work to an employee who can stock the machines for you.
How much can you make?

It all depends on your machines’ locations, sales, number of machines, and the overall success of your business. \nBut like most business opportunities and passive income streams, the more research and initial legwork you’re willing to do, and the more upfront capital you’re willing to spend, the greater your opportunities for profits will be down the road.

First you have to research as much as you can.\n Determine whether you’d like to purchase a machine and find locations yourself, buy an existing business or become a franchisee.\n Then you’ll need to purchase or lease machines.
Choose the right machine

But who cares about all that—you want to know how a vending machine business can help you earn extra cash. Here are the basics.
 You’ll need to deal with initial costs, mainly the purchasing of your machines themselves (though these can be financed.)
 Machines can cost anywhere from 10,000 or less for a used machine on Craigslist to 5,00,000 or more for a brand-new, high-tech model.
 From there your costs will be fairly low—as long as you have a small space like a garage to store stock and a vehicle to deliver it to your machines, you’ll have just about everything you need.
There are mainly 3 types of machines you can purchase:

Bulk machines - these are small in size and can dispense only a certain array of products 
 They are fairly cheap and cost around 50 to 200 because the potential profit you can earn is smaller too.
 Mechanical Machines -
 they are like an improved version of the bulk machines and can dispense multiple products, which is why their price is significantly higher.
 They cost around 20,000—30,000 per machine, but with a higher cost comes also a higher profit margin.
 Electronic machines - 
are the modern day vending machines with modern touch screens and systems that accept various different forms of payment (bills, coins, credit cards).
 While electronic machines costs a minimum of 30,000 for a basic model, they are also the most profitable types of vending machines currently on the market thanks to the acceptance of different payment methods.

You will need to find locations for your vending machines and come to agreements with the businesses or institutions where they’re placed. \n Excellent locations include high schools, offices, malls, small businesses, and other areas of high foot traffic. \n You’ll need to contact business owners or managers directly to come to an agreement that you’re both happy with—usually they’ll take around a 20% commission for providing the location and electricity.
Location, location, location
Operating costs
Besides the startup costs, there are still regular costs you will do during the period the vending machine is working. \n You will have to regularly count in refills, repairs and maintenance, as well

If you’ve got capital, but no interest, skills or time to put into actually operating and running a business, becoming a silent partner might be a great option for you.
 Like all investments, there’s some level of risk.
 But if you can throw your support behind some successful brands and people, you will be rewarded with massive ROI and a significant source of passive income that can indeed be life-changing.
 Let’s take a look at just what being a ‘silent partner’ means.

Not all investors in startups and other companies want to be directly involved in the decision-making process. 
A silent partner is a person who invests money in a business in order to receive a share of their profits, but doesn’t get involved with how the business is run or operated on a daily basis.
 That being said, silent partners often have a say regarding the overall big-picture and direction of companies in which they invest.
 The benefits of becoming a silent partner are numerous.
 First of all, you carry no responsibility to actually work towards the business’ success.
 That’s on the people who operate the business.
 You’re essentially just a bank, with the opportunity to get massively paid if the business succeeds.
 It’s a great way to receive passive income without constantly monitoring the direction your investment is taking.

If you have some capital to offer, but don’t want to invest a great deal of time and energy into a business, becoming a silent partner is the perfect opportunity for you.\n You have to be at least a little comfortable with risk, as even companies with huge potential can experience mismanagement, mistakes, or unpredictable market volatility that can derail their success.\n But if you have the savvy to pick smart recipients of your partnership, you’ll dramatically increase the likelihood of picking a winning horse.

This depends widely on your initial investment, share of the company, and that company’s profits and level of success.
But let’s give a short example to showcase how a silent partnership might develop. 
 DuckyDrone is a (imaginary) local startup that produces revolutionary WiFI-controlled and automated rubber ducks, and they’re in need of funding.
 You’ve seen their business plan and profits over the last few years, and it all looks very promising.
 You make an initial investment of $10,000 in return for a 10% share of the company. 
In the first two years of your silent partnership, they average $50,000 in profits annually.
 This covers your initial investment.
 The next year, they’re featured on DroneNet, an (imaginary) online drone magazine.
 Their profits explode, tripling to 15,00,000 that year.
 You pocket 1,50,000 that year.
 You’ve now doubled your investment, and then some. As the company grows, so do your earnings.
No day-to-day work for company\n Passive income can be huge if company performs well

Requires up-front investment of capital
 You’ll need to do a great deal of research before investing in any company.
 This will ensure that you have the absolute best chance of a good return-on-investment
 Even great businesses can experience bad fortune—you have no guarantee of earning back your investment.

Research and networking is key. Look for startups that have a strong initial possibility of success but might need some additional funding to get going. \nYou’ll also want to conduct some research into the legal requirements of entering into a silent partnership, which fortunately aren’t too complex. \nFrom there you can contact a business directly and inquire about their interest in taking you on as a silent partner.

Bringing the prestige and potential earnings of investing in a business with none of the day-to-day work, becoming a silent partner is a powerful opportunity for passive income. \nIt’s not without it’s risks, but if you’re willing to put in the legwork you’ll be rewarded with a higher possibility of success

Select the kind of bakery you'd like to open .
 One of the first decision you'II hve to make is the kind of shop you want to open .
To do this,you'II want to access your your talent,budget and goals.
 Be sure you're not making this decision in a bubble-you will want to have your ear to the ground on national trend in the industry-remeber the cupcake shop craze (and the cupcake-focused reality TV shows) a few year back?
 But don't simply take your finding at face value either.
Online
You don\'t need a storefront to open a bakery.\nYou can start out online.\n With a kill website,pictures of your work and a way to plan an order,you can run it from your home.
Counter services
With a samll commerical space,customers can walk in and pick up baked food goods from an employee-managed counter
Specialty Services
If you plan to specialize in a certain kind of baked good, a specialty services is your best option.\n Whether you run the business from your home or rent a space is up to you.

More owners are trying to captilize on the sit down and dine option.\n It\'s a growing trend in the bakery industry right now.\n Picture a space that has both an area to order baked goods and spot to sit and engoy them.

Speaking of friends and family,a support system is crucial in the baking business.
 Opening a business is time conusming.
 Time spent baking is only half the commitment.
 You'II need to market your business,take order,help coustomers and do an array of administrative tasks.

Freelancing is increasing each year as workers are desiring a way to control their schedule and their workload. Upwork, the popular freelance marketplace, found that 57 million Americans freelanced in 2019, an increase of 4 million since 2014.
Enter Your Desired Amount
It is Important that you can get profile more than 10lakh by investing 1lak
Let\'s see How can you earn ten lakh by investing almost one lak!
Now I am Going to tell you that how can you earn profit of minimum 8lakh and maximum 12lakh by investing 1lak
Property Required
If u rent a shop, Then Your advance of the shop will be about 50,000 to 2 lak
If you have your own shop, then u can have more profit than rental property
The rent of your shop is almost 20k-35k but if you have your own shop then you will earn more
Material Required for shop
Chargers

Market Place
